title: 4 de Julho Esporte Clube
text:
4 de Julho Esporte Clube, commonly known as 4 de Julho, is a Brazilian <a href="Association%20football">football</a> club based in <a href="Piripiri%2C%20Piau%C3%AD">Piripiri</a>, <a href="Piau%C3%AD">Piauí state</a>. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20B">Série B</a> once and in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a> twice.
History.
The club was founded on 4 July 1987, hence the name "4 de Julho" (4 July in English). 4 de Julho won the <a href="Campeonato%20Piauiense">Campeonato Piauiense</a> in 1992 and in 1993. They competed in the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20B">Série B</a> in <a href="1989%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20B">1989</a>, when they were eliminated in the First Stage. 4 de Julho was eliminated in the First Stage in the <a href="1993%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1993</a> and in the <a href="1997%20Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">1997</a> editions of the <a href="Campeonato%20Brasileiro%20S%C3%A9rie%20C">Série C</a>. The club won the Campeonato Piauiense for the third time in 2011, after beating <a href="Comercial%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Clube">Comercial</a> 1–0 in the first leg of the Final, and a 1–1 draw in the second leg, the games were played respectively on 10 and 17 August.
Stadium.
4 de Julho Esporte Clube play their home games at <a href="Est%C3%A1dio%20Municipal%20Helv%C3%ADdio%20Nunes%20de%20Barros%20%28Piripiri%29">Estádio Municipal Helvídio Nunes de Barros</a>, nicknamed "Arena Colorada". The stadium has a maximum capacity of 4,000 people.
